thread.title: Plates and cutlery scattered in plane aisle following 'dispute among cabin crew'
thread.title_full: Plates and cutlery scattered in plane aisle following 'dispute among cabin crew' | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Plates and cutlery scattered in plane aisle following 'dispute among cabin crew'
text:
138 shares 37
View
comments
A shocking image has emerged of meal trays and plates lying scattered in a plane aisle on a flight from Casablanca to Lisbon after an alleged dispute between two cabin crew members.
Passengers on the Morocco to Portugal flight were reportedly too scared to leave their seats fearing the noise was associated with a technical failure with the aircraft.
Reports did not confirm a reason for the disagreement but alleged it was due to a difference staff training levels.
Shocking image shows meal trays and plates lying scattering in a plane aisle on a flight from Moroccan capital, Casablanca to Lisbon in Portugal after an alleged dispute between two cabin crew members
The information appeared on forum site Crash Aerien , which claimed the objects had fallen as the Royal Air Maroc plane started its descent into Portela airport.
According to Moroccan news site Yabiladi , a witness on the flight said there had been a 'verbal dispute' between the two air hostesses, but that the disagreement had not led to a fight.
Despite the reports, the Moroccan national carrier disputed a fight had taken place between cabin crew.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next More than 2million passengers could claim compensation over... Woman who was banned from taking £125 brandy on to plane... Passenger jet carrying 150 people forced to burn off fuel... Put your neck pillow under your chin, skip the booze and try... Share this article Share 138 shares The airline tweeted a response to the incident saying: 'We rue news reports insinuating a fight between two members of staff on a Casablanca-Lisbon flight. The plates actually fell inadvertently.'
They followed this tweet up with a second post which said: 'We are sorry to all passengers on this flight for the disturbance caused'.
Yabiladi reported that a spokesperson from the airline said an air steward had forgotten to secure the service trolley, resulting in the plates and cutlery being dislodged with slight turbulence.
Royal Air Maroc told MailOnline Travel that there had not been a dispute between two air passengers.
It said in a statement: 'The flight took place in good conditions. At the end of catering service, cabin crew placed the trolley in the rollers. During the landing of the aircraft, the latch trolley opened and the products scattered on the floor.
'This surprised the passengers but did not cause any disruption to the operation of the flight. There was no dispute between the hostesses.'
Royal Air Maroc said over Twitter that the plates had fallen inadvertently and it denied there had been a dispute involved (Stock image)
The national airline was in the news earlier this week when it denied that one of its planes was damaged severly during an emergency landing at Agadir airport, according to the Telegraph .
The initial report stated that the aircraft’s underbelly scraped the ground after the wheels failed to engage, but that no passengers were injured in the incident.
Royal Air Maroc released a statement to say the aircraft didn't belong to the national carrier.
